6// TranslatorVulkan:
7// A GLSL-based translator that outputs shaders that fit GL_KHR_vulkan_glsl.
8// The shaders are then fed into glslang to spit out SPIR-V (libANGLE-side).
9// See: https://www.khronos.org/registry/vulkan/specs/misc/GL_KHR_vulkan_glsl.txt
10//
11

39namespace sh

42namespace
43{
44// This traverses nodes, find the struct ones and add their declarations to the sink. It also
45// removes the nodes from the tree as it processes them.
46class DeclareStructTypesTraverser : public TIntermTraverser
47{
48 public:
49 explicit DeclareStructTypesTraverser(TOutputVulkanGLSL *outputVulkanGLSL)
50 : TIntermTraverser(true, false, false), mOutputVulkanGLSL(outputVulkanGLSL)
51 {}
52
53 bool visitDeclaration(Visit visit, TIntermDeclaration *node) override
54 {
55 ASSERT(visit == PreVisit);
56
57 if (!mInGlobalScope)
58 {
59 return false;
60 }
61
62 const TIntermSequence &sequence = *(node->getSequence());
63 TIntermTyped *declarator = sequence.front()->getAsTyped();
64 const TType &type = declarator->getType();
65
66 if (type.isStructSpecifier())
67 {
68 const TStructure *structure = type.getStruct();
69
70 // Embedded structs should be parsed away by now.
71 ASSERT(structure->symbolType() != SymbolType::Empty);
72 mOutputVulkanGLSL->writeStructType(structure);
73
74 TIntermSymbol *symbolNode = declarator->getAsSymbolNode();
75 if (symbolNode && symbolNode->variable().symbolType() == SymbolType::Empty)
76 {
77 // Remove the struct specifier declaration from the tree so it isn't parsed again.
78 TIntermSequence emptyReplacement;
79 mMultiReplacements.emplace_back(getParentNode()->getAsBlock(), node,
80 emptyReplacement);
81 }
82 }
83
84 return false;
85 }
86
87 private:
88 TOutputVulkanGLSL *mOutputVulkanGLSL;
89};
90
91class DeclareDefaultUniformsTraverser : public TIntermTraverser
92{
93 public:
94 DeclareDefaultUniformsTraverser(TInfoSinkBase *sink,
95 ShHashFunction64 hashFunction,
96 NameMap *nameMap)
97 : TIntermTraverser(true, true, true),
98 mSink(sink),
99 mHashFunction(hashFunction),
100 mNameMap(nameMap),
101 mInDefaultUniform(false)
102 {}
103
104 bool visitDeclaration(Visit visit, TIntermDeclaration *node) override
105 {
106 const TIntermSequence &sequence = *(node->getSequence());
107
108 // TODO(jmadill): Compound declarations.
109 ASSERT(sequence.size() == 1);
110
111 TIntermTyped *variable = sequence.front()->getAsTyped();
112 const TType &type = variable->getType();
113 bool isUniform = type.getQualifier() == EvqUniform && !type.isInterfaceBlock() &&
114 !IsOpaqueType(type.getBasicType());
115
116 if (visit == PreVisit)
117 {
118 if (isUniform)
119 {
120 (*mSink) << " " << GetTypeName(type, mHashFunction, mNameMap) << " ";
121 mInDefaultUniform = true;
122 }
123 }
124 else if (visit == InVisit)
125 {
126 mInDefaultUniform = isUniform;
127 }
128 else if (visit == PostVisit)
129 {
130 if (isUniform)
131 {
132 (*mSink) << ";\n";
133
134 // Remove the uniform declaration from the tree so it isn't parsed again.
135 TIntermSequence emptyReplacement;
136 mMultiReplacements.emplace_back(getParentNode()->getAsBlock(), node,
137 emptyReplacement);
138 }
139
140 mInDefaultUniform = false;
141 }
142 return true;
143 }
144
145 void visitSymbol(TIntermSymbol *symbol) override
146 {
147 if (mInDefaultUniform)
148 {
149 const ImmutableString &name = symbol->variable().name();
150 ASSERT(!name.beginsWith("gl_"));
151 (*mSink) << HashName(&symbol->variable(), mHashFunction, mNameMap)
152 << ArrayString(symbol->getType());
153 }
154 }
155
156 private:
157 TInfoSinkBase *mSink;
158 ShHashFunction64 mHashFunction;
159 NameMap *mNameMap;
160 bool mInDefaultUniform;
161};
162
163constexpr ImmutableString kFlippedPointCoordName = ImmutableString("flippedPointCoord");
164constexpr ImmutableString kFlippedFragCoordName = ImmutableString("flippedFragCoord");
165constexpr ImmutableString kEmulatedDepthRangeParams = ImmutableString("ANGLEDepthRangeParams");
166constexpr ImmutableString kUniformsBlockName = ImmutableString("ANGLEUniformBlock");
167constexpr ImmutableString kUniformsVarName = ImmutableString("ANGLEUniforms");
168
169constexpr gl::ShaderMap<const char *> kDefaultUniformNames = {
170 {gl::ShaderType::Vertex, vk::kDefaultUniformsNameVS},
171 {gl::ShaderType::Geometry, vk::kDefaultUniformsNameGS},
172 {gl::ShaderType::Fragment, vk::kDefaultUniformsNameFS},
173 {gl::ShaderType::Compute, vk::kDefaultUniformsNameCS},
174};
175
176// Specialization constant names
177constexpr ImmutableString kLineRasterEmulationSpecConstVarName =
178 ImmutableString("ANGLELineRasterEmulation");
179
180constexpr const char kViewport[] = "viewport";
181constexpr const char kHalfRenderArea[] = "halfRenderArea";
182constexpr const char kFlipXY[] = "flipXY";
183constexpr const char kNegFlipXY[] = "negFlipXY";
184constexpr const char kClipDistancesEnabled[] = "clipDistancesEnabled";
185constexpr const char kXfbActiveUnpaused[] = "xfbActiveUnpaused";
186constexpr const char kXfbVerticesPerDraw[] = "xfbVerticesPerDraw";
187constexpr const char kXfbBufferOffsets[] = "xfbBufferOffsets";
188constexpr const char kAcbBufferOffsets[] = "acbBufferOffsets";
189constexpr const char kDepthRange[] = "depthRange";
190constexpr const char kPreRotation[] = "preRotation";
191constexpr const char kFragRotation[] = "fragRotation";
192
193constexpr size_t kNumGraphicsDriverUniforms = 12;
194constexpr std::array<const char *, kNumGraphicsDriverUniforms> kGraphicsDriverUniformNames = {
195 {kViewport, kHalfRenderArea, kFlipXY, kNegFlipXY, kClipDistancesEnabled, kXfbActiveUnpaused,
196 kXfbVerticesPerDraw, kXfbBufferOffsets, kAcbBufferOffsets, kDepthRange, kPreRotation,
197 kFragRotation}};
198
199constexpr size_t kNumComputeDriverUniforms = 1;
200constexpr std::array<const char *, kNumComputeDriverUniforms> kComputeDriverUniformNames = {
201 {kAcbBufferOffsets}};
202
203TIntermBinary *CreateDriverUniformRef(const TVariable *driverUniforms, const char *fieldName)
204{
205 size_t fieldIndex =
206 FindFieldIndex(driverUniforms->getType().getInterfaceBlock()->fields(), fieldName);
207
208 TIntermSymbol *angleUniformsRef = new TIntermSymbol(driverUniforms);
209 TConstantUnion *uniformIndex = new TConstantUnion;
210 uniformIndex->setIConst(static_cast<int>(fieldIndex));
211 TIntermConstantUnion *indexRef =
212 new TIntermConstantUnion(uniformIndex, *StaticType::GetBasic<EbtInt>());
213 return new TIntermBinary(EOpIndexDirectInterfaceBlock, angleUniformsRef, indexRef);
214}
215
216// Replaces a builtin variable with a version that is rotated and corrects the X and Y coordinates.
217ANGLE_NO_DISCARD bool RotateAndFlipBuiltinVariable(TCompiler *compiler,
218 TIntermBlock *root,
219 TIntermSequence *insertSequence,
220 TIntermTyped *flipXY,
221 TSymbolTable *symbolTable,
222 const TVariable *builtin,
223 const ImmutableString &flippedVariableName,
224 TIntermTyped *pivot,
225 TIntermTyped *fragRotation)
226{
227 // Create a symbol reference to 'builtin'.
228 TIntermSymbol *builtinRef = new TIntermSymbol(builtin);
229
230 // Create a swizzle to "builtin.xy"
231 TVector<int> swizzleOffsetXY = {0, 1};
232 TIntermSwizzle *builtinXY = new TIntermSwizzle(builtinRef, swizzleOffsetXY);
233
234 // Create a symbol reference to our new variable that will hold the modified builtin.
235 const TType *type = StaticType::GetForVec<EbtFloat>(
236 EvqGlobal, static_cast<unsigned char>(builtin->getType().getNominalSize()));
237 TVariable *replacementVar =
238 new TVariable(symbolTable, flippedVariableName, type, SymbolType::AngleInternal);
239 DeclareGlobalVariable(root, replacementVar);
240 TIntermSymbol *flippedBuiltinRef = new TIntermSymbol(replacementVar);
241
242 // Use this new variable instead of 'builtin' everywhere.
243 if (!ReplaceVariable(compiler, root, builtin, replacementVar))
244 {
245 return false;
246 }
247
248 // Create the expression "(builtin.xy * fragRotation)"
249 TIntermTyped *rotatedXY;
250 if (fragRotation)
251 {
252 rotatedXY = new TIntermBinary(EOpMatrixTimesVector, fragRotation->deepCopy(),
253 builtinXY->deepCopy());
254 }
255 else
256 {
257 // No rotation applied, use original variable.
258 rotatedXY = builtinXY->deepCopy();
259 }
260
261 // Create the expression "(builtin.xy - pivot) * flipXY + pivot
262 TIntermBinary *removePivot = new TIntermBinary(EOpSub, rotatedXY, pivot);
263 TIntermBinary *inverseXY = new TIntermBinary(EOpMul, removePivot, flipXY);
264 TIntermBinary *plusPivot = new TIntermBinary(EOpAdd, inverseXY, pivot->deepCopy());
265
266 // Create the corrected variable and copy the value of the original builtin.
267 TIntermSequence *sequence = new TIntermSequence();
268 sequence->push_back(builtinRef->deepCopy());
269 TIntermAggregate *aggregate = TIntermAggregate::CreateConstructor(builtin->getType(), sequence);
270 TIntermBinary *assignment = new TIntermBinary(EOpInitialize, flippedBuiltinRef, aggregate);
271
272 // Create an assignment to the replaced variable's .xy.
273 TIntermSwizzle *correctedXY =
274 new TIntermSwizzle(flippedBuiltinRef->deepCopy(), swizzleOffsetXY);
275 TIntermBinary *assignToY = new TIntermBinary(EOpAssign, correctedXY, plusPivot);
276
277 // Add this assigment at the beginning of the main function
278 insertSequence->insert(insertSequence->begin(), assignToY);
279 insertSequence->insert(insertSequence->begin(), assignment);
280
281 return compiler->validateAST(root);
282}
283
284TIntermSequence *GetMainSequence(TIntermBlock *root)
285{
286 TIntermFunctionDefinition *main = FindMain(root);
287 return main->getBody()->getSequence();
288}
289
290// Declares a new variable to replace gl_DepthRange, its values are fed from a driver uniform.
291ANGLE_NO_DISCARD bool ReplaceGLDepthRangeWithDriverUniform(TCompiler *compiler,
292 TIntermBlock *root,
293 const TVariable *driverUniforms,
294 TSymbolTable *symbolTable)
295{
296 // Create a symbol reference to "gl_DepthRange"
297 const TVariable *depthRangeVar = static_cast<const TVariable *>(
298 symbolTable->findBuiltIn(ImmutableString("gl_DepthRange"), 0));
299
300 // ANGLEUniforms.depthRange
301 TIntermBinary *angleEmulatedDepthRangeRef = CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kDepthRange);
302
303 // Use this variable instead of gl_DepthRange everywhere.
304 return ReplaceVariableWithTyped(compiler, root, depthRangeVar, angleEmulatedDepthRangeRef);
305}
306
307// This operation performs the viewport depth translation needed by Vulkan. In GL the viewport
308// transformation is slightly different - see the GL 2.0 spec section "2.12.1 Controlling the
309// Viewport". In Vulkan the corresponding spec section is currently "23.4. Coordinate
310// Transformations".
311// The equations reduce to an expression:
312//
313// z_vk = 0.5 * (w_gl + z_gl)
314//
315// where z_vk is the depth output of a Vulkan vertex shader and z_gl is the same for GL.
316ANGLE_NO_DISCARD bool AppendVertexShaderDepthCorrectionToMain(TCompiler *compiler,
317 TIntermBlock *root,
318 TSymbolTable *symbolTable)
319{
320 // Create a symbol reference to "gl_Position"
321 const TVariable *position = BuiltInVariable::gl_Position();
322 TIntermSymbol *positionRef = new TIntermSymbol(position);
323
324 // Create a swizzle to "gl_Position.z"
325 TVector<int> swizzleOffsetZ = {2};
326 TIntermSwizzle *positionZ = new TIntermSwizzle(positionRef, swizzleOffsetZ);
327
328 // Create a constant "0.5"
329 TIntermConstantUnion *oneHalf = CreateFloatNode(0.5f);
330
331 // Create a swizzle to "gl_Position.w"
332 TVector<int> swizzleOffsetW = {3};
333 TIntermSwizzle *positionW = new TIntermSwizzle(positionRef->deepCopy(), swizzleOffsetW);
334
335 // Create the expression "(gl_Position.z + gl_Position.w) * 0.5".
336 TIntermBinary *zPlusW = new TIntermBinary(EOpAdd, positionZ->deepCopy(), positionW->deepCopy());
337 TIntermBinary *halfZPlusW = new TIntermBinary(EOpMul, zPlusW, oneHalf->deepCopy());
338
339 // Create the assignment "gl_Position.z = (gl_Position.z + gl_Position.w) * 0.5"
340 TIntermTyped *positionZLHS = positionZ->deepCopy();
341 TIntermBinary *assignment = new TIntermBinary(TOperator::EOpAssign, positionZLHS, halfZPlusW);
342
343 // Append the assignment as a statement at the end of the shader.
344 return RunAtTheEndOfShader(compiler, root, assignment, symbolTable);
345}
346
347// This operation performs Android pre-rotation and y-flip. For Android (and potentially other
348// platforms), the device may rotate, such that the orientation of the application is rotated
349// relative to the native orientation of the device. This is corrected in part by multiplying
350// gl_Position by a mat2.
351// The equations reduce to an expression:
352//
353// gl_Position.xy = gl_Position.xy * preRotation
354ANGLE_NO_DISCARD bool AppendPreRotation(TCompiler *compiler,
355 TIntermBlock *root,
356 TSymbolTable *symbolTable,
357 const TVariable *driverUniforms)
358{
359 TIntermBinary *preRotationRef = CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kPreRotation);
360 TIntermSymbol *glPos = new TIntermSymbol(BuiltInVariable::gl_Position());
361 TVector<int> swizzleOffsetXY = {0, 1};
362 TIntermSwizzle *glPosXY = new TIntermSwizzle(glPos, swizzleOffsetXY);
363
364 // Create the expression "(gl_Position.xy * preRotation)"
365 TIntermBinary *zRotated =
366 new TIntermBinary(EOpMatrixTimesVector, preRotationRef->deepCopy(), glPosXY->deepCopy());
367
368 // Create the assignment "gl_Position.xy = (gl_Position.xy * preRotation)"
369 TIntermBinary *assignment =
370 new TIntermBinary(TOperator::EOpAssign, glPosXY->deepCopy(), zRotated);
371
372 // Append the assignment as a statement at the end of the shader.
373 return RunAtTheEndOfShader(compiler, root, assignment, symbolTable);
374}
375
376ANGLE_NO_DISCARD bool AppendVertexShaderTransformFeedbackOutputToMain(TCompiler *compiler,
377 TIntermBlock *root,
378 TSymbolTable *symbolTable)
379{
380 TVariable *xfbPlaceholder = new TVariable(symbolTable, ImmutableString("@@ XFB-OUT @@"),
381 new TType(), SymbolType::AngleInternal);
382
383 // Append the assignment as a statement at the end of the shader.
384 return RunAtTheEndOfShader(compiler, root, new TIntermSymbol(xfbPlaceholder), symbolTable);
385}
386
387// The Add*DriverUniformsToShader operation adds an internal uniform block to a shader. The driver
388// block is used to implement Vulkan-specific features and workarounds. Returns the driver uniforms
389// variable.
390//
391// There are Graphics and Compute variations as they require different uniforms.
392const TVariable *AddGraphicsDriverUniformsToShader(TIntermBlock *root,
393 TSymbolTable *symbolTable,
394 const std::vector<TField *> &additionalFields)
395{
396 // Init the depth range type.
397 TFieldList *depthRangeParamsFields = new TFieldList();
398 depthRangeParamsFields->push_back(new TField(new TType(EbtFloat, EbpHigh, EvqGlobal, 1, 1),
399 ImmutableString("near"), TSourceLoc(),
400 SymbolType::AngleInternal));
401 depthRangeParamsFields->push_back(new TField(new TType(EbtFloat, EbpHigh, EvqGlobal, 1, 1),
402 ImmutableString("far"), TSourceLoc(),
403 SymbolType::AngleInternal));
404 depthRangeParamsFields->push_back(new TField(new TType(EbtFloat, EbpHigh, EvqGlobal, 1, 1),
405 ImmutableString("diff"), TSourceLoc(),
406 SymbolType::AngleInternal));
407 // This additional field might be used by subclass such as TranslatorMetal.
408 depthRangeParamsFields->push_back(new TField(new TType(EbtFloat, EbpHigh, EvqGlobal, 1, 1),
409 ImmutableString("reserved"), TSourceLoc(),
410 SymbolType::AngleInternal));
411 TStructure *emulatedDepthRangeParams = new TStructure(
412 symbolTable, kEmulatedDepthRangeParams, depthRangeParamsFields, SymbolType::AngleInternal);
413 TType *emulatedDepthRangeType = new TType(emulatedDepthRangeParams, false);
414
415 // Declare a global depth range variable.
416 TVariable *depthRangeVar =
417 new TVariable(symbolTable->nextUniqueId(), kEmptyImmutableString, SymbolType::Empty,
418 TExtension::UNDEFINED, emulatedDepthRangeType);
419
420 DeclareGlobalVariable(root, depthRangeVar);
421
422 // This field list mirrors the structure of GraphicsDriverUniforms in ContextVk.cpp.
423 TFieldList *driverFieldList = new TFieldList;
424
425 const std::array<TType *, kNumGraphicsDriverUniforms> kDriverUniformTypes = {{
426 new TType(EbtFloat, 4),
427 new TType(EbtFloat, 2),
428 new TType(EbtFloat, 2),
429 new TType(EbtFloat, 2),
430 new TType(EbtUInt), // uint clipDistancesEnabled; // 32 bits for 32 clip distances max
431 new TType(EbtUInt),
432 new TType(EbtUInt),
433 // NOTE: There's a vec3 gap here that can be used in the future
434 new TType(EbtInt, 4),
435 new TType(EbtUInt, 4),
436 emulatedDepthRangeType,
437 new TType(EbtFloat, 2, 2),
438 new TType(EbtFloat, 2, 2),
439 }};
440
441 for (size_t uniformIndex = 0; uniformIndex < kNumGraphicsDriverUniforms; ++uniformIndex)
442 {
443 TField *driverUniformField =
444 new TField(kDriverUniformTypes[uniformIndex],
445 ImmutableString(kGraphicsDriverUniformNames[uniformIndex]), TSourceLoc(),
446 SymbolType::AngleInternal);
447 driverFieldList->push_back(driverUniformField);
448 }
449
450 // Back-end specific fields
451 driverFieldList->insert(driverFieldList->end(), additionalFields.begin(),
452 additionalFields.end());
453
454 // Define a driver uniform block "ANGLEUniformBlock" with instance name "ANGLEUniforms".
455 return DeclareInterfaceBlock(root, symbolTable, driverFieldList, EvqUniform,
456 TMemoryQualifier::Create(), 0, kUniformsBlockName,
457 kUniformsVarName);
458}
459
460const TVariable *AddComputeDriverUniformsToShader(TIntermBlock *root, TSymbolTable *symbolTable)
461{
462 // This field list mirrors the structure of ComputeDriverUniforms in ContextVk.cpp.
463 TFieldList *driverFieldList = new TFieldList;
464
465 const std::array<TType *, kNumComputeDriverUniforms> kDriverUniformTypes = {{
466 new TType(EbtUInt, 4),
467 }};
468
469 for (size_t uniformIndex = 0; uniformIndex < kNumComputeDriverUniforms; ++uniformIndex)
470 {
471 TField *driverUniformField =
472 new TField(kDriverUniformTypes[uniformIndex],
473 ImmutableString(kComputeDriverUniformNames[uniformIndex]), TSourceLoc(),
474 SymbolType::AngleInternal);
475 driverFieldList->push_back(driverUniformField);
476 }
477
478 // Define a driver uniform block "ANGLEUniformBlock" with instance name "ANGLEUniforms".
479 return DeclareInterfaceBlock(
480 root, symbolTable, driverFieldList, EvqUniform, TMemoryQualifier::Create(), 0,
481 ImmutableString(vk::kDriverUniformsBlockName), ImmutableString(vk::kDriverUniformsVarName));
482}
483
484TIntermSymbol *GenerateLineRasterSpecConstRef(TSymbolTable *symbolTable)
485{
486 TVariable *specConstVar =
487 new TVariable(symbolTable, kLineRasterEmulationSpecConstVarName,
488 StaticType::GetBasic<EbtBool>(), SymbolType::AngleInternal);
489 return new TIntermSymbol(specConstVar);
490}
491
492TVariable *AddANGLEPositionVaryingDeclaration(TIntermBlock *root,
493 TSymbolTable *symbolTable,
494 TQualifier qualifier)
495{
496 // Define a vec2 driver varying to hold the line rasterization emulation position.
497 TType *varyingType = new TType(EbtFloat, EbpMedium, qualifier, 2);
498 TVariable *varyingVar =
499 new TVariable(symbolTable, ImmutableString(vk::kLineRasterEmulationPosition), varyingType,
500 SymbolType::AngleInternal);
501 TIntermSymbol *varyingDeclarator = new TIntermSymbol(varyingVar);
502 TIntermDeclaration *varyingDecl = new TIntermDeclaration;
503 varyingDecl->appendDeclarator(varyingDeclarator);
504
505 TIntermSequence *insertSequence = new TIntermSequence;
506 insertSequence->push_back(varyingDecl);
507
508 // Insert the declarations before Main.
509 size_t mainIndex = FindMainIndex(root);
510 root->insertChildNodes(mainIndex, *insertSequence);
511
512 return varyingVar;
513}
514
515ANGLE_NO_DISCARD bool AddBresenhamEmulationVS(TCompiler *compiler,
516 TIntermBlock *root,
517 TSymbolTable *symbolTable,
518 const TVariable *driverUniforms)
519{
520 TVariable *anglePosition = AddANGLEPositionVaryingDeclaration(root, symbolTable, EvqVaryingOut);
521
522 // Clamp position to subpixel grid.
523 // Do perspective divide (get normalized device coords)
524 // "vec2 ndc = gl_Position.xy / gl_Position.w"
525 const TType *vec2Type = StaticType::GetBasic<EbtFloat, 2>();
526 TIntermBinary *viewportRef = CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kViewport);
527 TIntermSymbol *glPos = new TIntermSymbol(BuiltInVariable::gl_Position());
528 TIntermSwizzle *glPosXY = CreateSwizzle(glPos, 0, 1);
529 TIntermSwizzle *glPosW = CreateSwizzle(glPos->deepCopy(), 3);
530 TVariable *ndc = CreateTempVariable(symbolTable, vec2Type);
531 TIntermBinary *noPerspective = new TIntermBinary(EOpDiv, glPosXY, glPosW);
532 TIntermDeclaration *ndcDecl = CreateTempInitDeclarationNode(ndc, noPerspective);
533
534 // Convert NDC to window coordinates. According to Vulkan spec.
535 // "vec2 window = 0.5 * viewport.wh * (ndc + 1) + viewport.xy"
536 TIntermBinary *ndcPlusOne =
537 new TIntermBinary(EOpAdd, CreateTempSymbolNode(ndc), CreateFloatNode(1.0f));
538 TIntermSwizzle *viewportZW = CreateSwizzle(viewportRef, 2, 3);
539 TIntermBinary *ndcViewport = new TIntermBinary(EOpMul, viewportZW, ndcPlusOne);
540 TIntermBinary *ndcViewportHalf =
541 new TIntermBinary(EOpVectorTimesScalar, ndcViewport, CreateFloatNode(0.5f));
542 TIntermSwizzle *viewportXY = CreateSwizzle(viewportRef->deepCopy(), 0, 1);
543 TIntermBinary *ndcToWindow = new TIntermBinary(EOpAdd, ndcViewportHalf, viewportXY);
544 TVariable *windowCoords = CreateTempVariable(symbolTable, vec2Type);
545 TIntermDeclaration *windowDecl = CreateTempInitDeclarationNode(windowCoords, ndcToWindow);
546
547 // Clamp to subpixel grid.
548 // "vec2 clamped = round(window * 2^{subpixelBits}) / 2^{subpixelBits}"
549 int subpixelBits = compiler->getResources().SubPixelBits;
550 TIntermConstantUnion *scaleConstant = CreateFloatNode(static_cast<float>(1 << subpixelBits));
551 TIntermBinary *windowScaled =
552 new TIntermBinary(EOpVectorTimesScalar, CreateTempSymbolNode(windowCoords), scaleConstant);
553 TIntermUnary *windowRounded = new TIntermUnary(EOpRound, windowScaled, nullptr);
554 TIntermBinary *windowRoundedBack =
555 new TIntermBinary(EOpDiv, windowRounded, scaleConstant->deepCopy());
556 TVariable *clampedWindowCoords = CreateTempVariable(symbolTable, vec2Type);
557 TIntermDeclaration *clampedDecl =
558 CreateTempInitDeclarationNode(clampedWindowCoords, windowRoundedBack);
559
560 // Set varying.
561 // "ANGLEPosition = 2 * (clamped - viewport.xy) / viewport.wh - 1"
562 TIntermBinary *clampedOffset = new TIntermBinary(
563 EOpSub, CreateTempSymbolNode(clampedWindowCoords), viewportXY->deepCopy());
564 TIntermBinary *clampedOff2x =
565 new TIntermBinary(EOpVectorTimesScalar, clampedOffset, CreateFloatNode(2.0f));
566 TIntermBinary *clampedDivided = new TIntermBinary(EOpDiv, clampedOff2x, viewportZW->deepCopy());
567 TIntermBinary *clampedNDC = new TIntermBinary(EOpSub, clampedDivided, CreateFloatNode(1.0f));
568 TIntermSymbol *varyingRef = new TIntermSymbol(anglePosition);
569 TIntermBinary *varyingAssign = new TIntermBinary(EOpAssign, varyingRef, clampedNDC);
570
571 TIntermBlock *emulationBlock = new TIntermBlock;
572 emulationBlock->appendStatement(ndcDecl);
573 emulationBlock->appendStatement(windowDecl);
574 emulationBlock->appendStatement(clampedDecl);
575 emulationBlock->appendStatement(varyingAssign);
576 TIntermIfElse *ifEmulation =
577 new TIntermIfElse(GenerateLineRasterSpecConstRef(symbolTable), emulationBlock, nullptr);
578
579 // Ensure the statements run at the end of the main() function.
580 TIntermFunctionDefinition *main = FindMain(root);
581 TIntermBlock *mainBody = main->getBody();
582 mainBody->appendStatement(ifEmulation);
583 return compiler->validateAST(root);
584}
585
586ANGLE_NO_DISCARD bool InsertFragCoordCorrection(TCompiler *compiler,
587 ShCompileOptions compileOptions,
588 TIntermBlock *root,
589 TIntermSequence *insertSequence,
590 TSymbolTable *symbolTable,
591 const TVariable *driverUniforms)
592{
593 TIntermBinary *flipXY = CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kFlipXY);
594 TIntermBinary *pivot = CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kHalfRenderArea);
595 TIntermBinary *fragRotation = (compileOptions & SH_ADD_PRE_ROTATION)
596 ? CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kFragRotation)
597 : nullptr;
598 return RotateAndFlipBuiltinVariable(compiler, root, insertSequence, flipXY, symbolTable,
599 BuiltInVariable::gl_FragCoord(), kFlippedFragCoordName,
600 pivot, fragRotation);
601}
602
603// This block adds OpenGL line segment rasterization emulation behind a specialization constant
604// guard. OpenGL's simple rasterization algorithm is a strict subset of the pixels generated by the
605// Vulkan algorithm. Thus we can implement a shader patch that rejects pixels if they would not be
606// generated by the OpenGL algorithm. OpenGL's algorithm is similar to Bresenham's line algorithm.
607// It is implemented for each pixel by testing if the line segment crosses a small diamond inside
608// the pixel. See the OpenGL ES 2.0 spec section "3.4.1 Basic Line Segment Rasterization". Also
609// see the Vulkan spec section "24.6.1. Basic Line Segment Rasterization":
610// https://khronos.org/registry/vulkan/specs/1.0/html/vkspec.html#primsrast-lines-basic
611//
612// Using trigonometric math and the fact that we know the size of the diamond we can derive a
613// formula to test if the line segment crosses the pixel center. gl_FragCoord is used along with an
614// internal position varying to determine the inputs to the formula.
615//
616// The implementation of the test is similar to the following pseudocode:
617//
618// void main()
619// {
620// vec2 p = (((((ANGLEPosition.xy) * 0.5) + 0.5) * viewport.zw) + viewport.xy);
621// vec2 d = dFdx(p) + dFdy(p);
622// vec2 f = gl_FragCoord.xy;
623// vec2 p_ = p.yx;
624// vec2 d_ = d.yx;
625// vec2 f_ = f.yx;
626//
627// vec2 i = abs(p - f + (d / d_) * (f_ - p_));
628//
629// if (i.x > (0.5 + e) && i.y > (0.5 + e))
630// discard;
631// <otherwise run fragment shader main>
632// }
633//
634// Note this emulation can not provide fully correct rasterization. See the docs more more info.
635
636ANGLE_NO_DISCARD bool AddBresenhamEmulationFS(TCompiler *compiler,
637 ShCompileOptions compileOptions,
638 TInfoSinkBase &sink,
639 TIntermBlock *root,
640 TSymbolTable *symbolTable,
641 const TVariable *driverUniforms,
642 bool usesFragCoord)
643{
644 TVariable *anglePosition = AddANGLEPositionVaryingDeclaration(root, symbolTable, EvqVaryingIn);
645 const TType *vec2Type = StaticType::GetBasic<EbtFloat, 2>();
646 TIntermBinary *viewportRef = CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kViewport);
647
648 // vec2 p = ((ANGLEPosition * 0.5) + 0.5) * viewport.zw + viewport.xy
649 TIntermSwizzle *viewportXY = CreateSwizzle(viewportRef->deepCopy(), 0, 1);
650 TIntermSwizzle *viewportZW = CreateSwizzle(viewportRef, 2, 3);
651 TIntermSymbol *position = new TIntermSymbol(anglePosition);
652 TIntermConstantUnion *oneHalf = CreateFloatNode(0.5f);
653 TIntermBinary *halfPosition = new TIntermBinary(EOpVectorTimesScalar, position, oneHalf);
654 TIntermBinary *offsetHalfPosition =
655 new TIntermBinary(EOpAdd, halfPosition, oneHalf->deepCopy());
656 TIntermBinary *scaledPosition = new TIntermBinary(EOpMul, offsetHalfPosition, viewportZW);
657 TIntermBinary *windowPosition = new TIntermBinary(EOpAdd, scaledPosition, viewportXY);
658 TVariable *p = CreateTempVariable(symbolTable, vec2Type);
659 TIntermDeclaration *pDecl = CreateTempInitDeclarationNode(p, windowPosition);
660
661 // vec2 d = dFdx(p) + dFdy(p)
662 TIntermUnary *dfdx = new TIntermUnary(EOpDFdx, new TIntermSymbol(p), nullptr);
663 TIntermUnary *dfdy = new TIntermUnary(EOpDFdy, new TIntermSymbol(p), nullptr);
664 TIntermBinary *dfsum = new TIntermBinary(EOpAdd, dfdx, dfdy);
665 TVariable *d = CreateTempVariable(symbolTable, vec2Type);
666 TIntermDeclaration *dDecl = CreateTempInitDeclarationNode(d, dfsum);
667
668 // vec2 f = gl_FragCoord.xy
669 const TVariable *fragCoord = BuiltInVariable::gl_FragCoord();
670 TIntermSwizzle *fragCoordXY = CreateSwizzle(new TIntermSymbol(fragCoord), 0, 1);
671 TVariable *f = CreateTempVariable(symbolTable, vec2Type);
672 TIntermDeclaration *fDecl = CreateTempInitDeclarationNode(f, fragCoordXY);
673
674 // vec2 p_ = p.yx
675 TIntermSwizzle *pyx = CreateSwizzle(new TIntermSymbol(p), 1, 0);
676 TVariable *p_ = CreateTempVariable(symbolTable, vec2Type);
677 TIntermDeclaration *p_decl = CreateTempInitDeclarationNode(p_, pyx);
678
679 // vec2 d_ = d.yx
680 TIntermSwizzle *dyx = CreateSwizzle(new TIntermSymbol(d), 1, 0);
681 TVariable *d_ = CreateTempVariable(symbolTable, vec2Type);
682 TIntermDeclaration *d_decl = CreateTempInitDeclarationNode(d_, dyx);
683
684 // vec2 f_ = f.yx
685 TIntermSwizzle *fyx = CreateSwizzle(new TIntermSymbol(f), 1, 0);
686 TVariable *f_ = CreateTempVariable(symbolTable, vec2Type);
687 TIntermDeclaration *f_decl = CreateTempInitDeclarationNode(f_, fyx);
688
689 // vec2 i = abs(p - f + (d/d_) * (f_ - p_))
690 TIntermBinary *dd = new TIntermBinary(EOpDiv, new TIntermSymbol(d), new TIntermSymbol(d_));
691 TIntermBinary *fp = new TIntermBinary(EOpSub, new TIntermSymbol(f_), new TIntermSymbol(p_));
692 TIntermBinary *ddfp = new TIntermBinary(EOpMul, dd, fp);
693 TIntermBinary *pf = new TIntermBinary(EOpSub, new TIntermSymbol(p), new TIntermSymbol(f));
694 TIntermBinary *expr = new TIntermBinary(EOpAdd, pf, ddfp);
695 TIntermUnary *absd = new TIntermUnary(EOpAbs, expr, nullptr);
696 TVariable *i = CreateTempVariable(symbolTable, vec2Type);
697 TIntermDeclaration *iDecl = CreateTempInitDeclarationNode(i, absd);
698
699 // Using a small epsilon value ensures that we don't suffer from numerical instability when
700 // lines are exactly vertical or horizontal.
701 static constexpr float kEpsilon = 0.0001f;
702 static constexpr float kThreshold = 0.5 + kEpsilon;
703 TIntermConstantUnion *threshold = CreateFloatNode(kThreshold);
704
705 // if (i.x > (0.5 + e) && i.y > (0.5 + e))
706 TIntermSwizzle *ix = CreateSwizzle(new TIntermSymbol(i), 0);
707 TIntermBinary *checkX = new TIntermBinary(EOpGreaterThan, ix, threshold);
708 TIntermSwizzle *iy = CreateSwizzle(new TIntermSymbol(i), 1);
709 TIntermBinary *checkY = new TIntermBinary(EOpGreaterThan, iy, threshold->deepCopy());
710 TIntermBinary *checkXY = new TIntermBinary(EOpLogicalAnd, checkX, checkY);
711
712 // discard
713 TIntermBranch *discard = new TIntermBranch(EOpKill, nullptr);
714 TIntermBlock *discardBlock = new TIntermBlock;
715 discardBlock->appendStatement(discard);
716 TIntermIfElse *ifStatement = new TIntermIfElse(checkXY, discardBlock, nullptr);
717
718 TIntermBlock *emulationBlock = new TIntermBlock;
719 TIntermSequence *emulationSequence = emulationBlock->getSequence();
720
721 std::array<TIntermNode *, 8> nodes = {
722 {pDecl, dDecl, fDecl, p_decl, d_decl, f_decl, iDecl, ifStatement}};
723 emulationSequence->insert(emulationSequence->begin(), nodes.begin(), nodes.end());
724
725 TIntermIfElse *ifEmulation =
726 new TIntermIfElse(GenerateLineRasterSpecConstRef(symbolTable), emulationBlock, nullptr);
727
728 // Ensure the line raster code runs at the beginning of main().
729 TIntermFunctionDefinition *main = FindMain(root);
730 TIntermSequence *mainSequence = main->getBody()->getSequence();
731 ASSERT(mainSequence);
732
733 mainSequence->insert(mainSequence->begin(), ifEmulation);
734
735 // If the shader does not use frag coord, we should insert it inside the emulation if.
736 if (!usesFragCoord)
737 {
738 if (!InsertFragCoordCorrection(compiler, compileOptions, root, emulationSequence,
739 symbolTable, driverUniforms))
740 {
741 return false;
742 }
743 }
744
745 return compiler->validateAST(root);
746}
747
748} // anonymous namespace
749
750TranslatorVulkan::TranslatorVulkan(sh::GLenum type, ShShaderSpec spec)
751 : TCompiler(type, spec, SH_GLSL_450_CORE_OUTPUT)
752{}
753
754bool TranslatorVulkan::translateImpl(TIntermBlock *root,
755 ShCompileOptions compileOptions,
756 PerformanceDiagnostics * /*perfDiagnostics*/,
757 const TVariable **driverUniformsOut,
758 TOutputVulkanGLSL *outputGLSL)
759{
760 TInfoSinkBase &sink = getInfoSink().obj;
761
762 if (getShaderType() == GL_VERTEX_SHADER)
763 {
764 if (!ShaderBuiltinsWorkaround(this, root, &getSymbolTable(), compileOptions))
765 {
766 return false;
767 }
768 }
769
770 sink << "#version 450 core\n";
771
772 // Write out default uniforms into a uniform block assigned to a specific set/binding.
773 int defaultUniformCount = 0;
774 int aggregateTypesUsedForUniforms = 0;
775 int atomicCounterCount = 0;
776 for (const auto &uniform : getUniforms())
777 {
778 if (!uniform.isBuiltIn() && uniform.active && !gl::IsOpaqueType(uniform.type))
779 {
780 ++defaultUniformCount;
781 }
782
783 if (uniform.isStruct() || uniform.isArrayOfArrays())
784 {
785 ++aggregateTypesUsedForUniforms;
786 }
787
788 if (uniform.active && gl::IsAtomicCounterType(uniform.type))
789 {
790 ++atomicCounterCount;
791 }
792 }
793
794 // Remove declarations of inactive shader interface variables so glslang wrapper doesn't need to
795 // replace them. Note: this is done before extracting samplers from structs, as removing such
796 // inactive samplers is not yet supported. Note also that currently, CollectVariables marks
797 // every field of an active uniform that's of struct type as active, i.e. no extracted sampler
798 // is inactive.
799 if (!RemoveInactiveInterfaceVariables(this, root, getAttributes(), getInputVaryings(),
800 getOutputVariables(), getUniforms(),
801 getInterfaceBlocks()))
802 {
803 return false;
804 }
805
806 // TODO(lucferron): Refactor this function to do fewer tree traversals.
807 // http://anglebug.com/2461
808 if (aggregateTypesUsedForUniforms > 0)
809 {
810 if (!NameEmbeddedStructUniforms(this, root, &getSymbolTable()))
811 {
812 return false;
813 }
814
815 bool rewriteStructSamplersResult;
816 int removedUniformsCount;
817
818 if (compileOptions & SH_USE_OLD_REWRITE_STRUCT_SAMPLERS)
819 {
820 rewriteStructSamplersResult =
821 RewriteStructSamplersOld(this, root, &getSymbolTable(), &removedUniformsCount);
822 }
823 else
824 {
825 rewriteStructSamplersResult =
826 RewriteStructSamplers(this, root, &getSymbolTable(), &removedUniformsCount);
827 }
828
829 if (!rewriteStructSamplersResult)
830 {
831 return false;
832 }
833 defaultUniformCount -= removedUniformsCount;
834
835 // We must declare the struct types before using them.
836 DeclareStructTypesTraverser structTypesTraverser(outputGLSL);
837 root->traverse(&structTypesTraverser);
838 if (!structTypesTraverser.updateTree(this, root))
839 {
840 return false;
841 }
842 }
843
844 // Rewrite samplerCubes as sampler2DArrays. This must be done after rewriting struct samplers
845 // as it doesn't expect that.
846 if (compileOptions & SH_EMULATE_SEAMFUL_CUBE_MAP_SAMPLING)
847 {
848 if (!RewriteCubeMapSamplersAs2DArray(this, root, &getSymbolTable(),
849 getShaderType() == GL_FRAGMENT_SHADER))
850 {
851 return false;
852 }
853 }
854
855 if (!FlagSamplersForTexelFetch(this, root, &getSymbolTable(), &mUniforms))
856 {
857 return false;
858 }
859
860 if (defaultUniformCount > 0)
861 {
862 gl::ShaderType shaderType = gl::FromGLenum<gl::ShaderType>(getShaderType());
863 sink << "\nlayout(set=0, binding=" << outputGLSL->nextUnusedBinding()
864 << ", std140) uniform " << kDefaultUniformNames[shaderType] << "\n{\n";
865
866 DeclareDefaultUniformsTraverser defaultTraverser(&sink, getHashFunction(), &getNameMap());
867 root->traverse(&defaultTraverser);
868 if (!defaultTraverser.updateTree(this, root))
869 {
870 return false;
871 }
872
873 sink << "};\n";
874 }
875
876 const TVariable *driverUniforms;
877 if (getShaderType() == GL_COMPUTE_SHADER)
878 {
879 driverUniforms = AddComputeDriverUniformsToShader(root, &getSymbolTable());
880 }
881 else
882 {
883 std::vector<TField *> additionalFields;
884 createAdditionalGraphicsDriverUniformFields(&additionalFields);
885 driverUniforms =
886 AddGraphicsDriverUniformsToShader(root, &getSymbolTable(), additionalFields);
887 }
888
889 if (atomicCounterCount > 0)
890 {
891 // ANGLEUniforms.acbBufferOffsets
892 const TIntermBinary *acbBufferOffsets =
893 CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kAcbBufferOffsets);
894
895 if (!RewriteAtomicCounters(this, root, &getSymbolTable(), acbBufferOffsets))
896 {
897 return false;
898 }
899 }
900 else if (getShaderVersion() >= 310)
901 {
902 // Vulkan doesn't support Atomic Storage as a Storage Class, but we've seen
903 // cases where builtins are using it even with no active atomic counters.
904 // This pass simply removes those builtins in that scenario.
905 if (!RemoveAtomicCounterBuiltins(this, root))
906 {
907 return false;
908 }
909 }
910
911 if (getShaderType() != GL_COMPUTE_SHADER)
912 {
913 if (!ReplaceGLDepthRangeWithDriverUniform(this, root, driverUniforms, &getSymbolTable()))
914 {
915 return false;
916 }
917
918 // Add specialization constant declarations. The default value of the specialization
919 // constant is irrelevant, as it will be set when creating the pipeline.
920 if (compileOptions & SH_ADD_BRESENHAM_LINE_RASTER_EMULATION)
921 {
922 sink << "layout(constant_id="
923 << static_cast<uint32_t>(vk::SpecializationConstantId::LineRasterEmulation)
924 << ") const bool " << kLineRasterEmulationSpecConstVarName << " = false;\n\n";
925 }
926 }
927
928 // Declare gl_FragColor and glFragData as webgl_FragColor and webgl_FragData
929 // if it's core profile shaders and they are used.
930 if (getShaderType() == GL_FRAGMENT_SHADER)
931 {
932 bool usesPointCoord = false;
933 bool usesFragCoord = false;
934
935 // Search for the gl_PointCoord usage, if its used, we need to flip the y coordinate.
936 for (const ShaderVariable &inputVarying : mInputVaryings)
937 {
938 if (!inputVarying.isBuiltIn())
939 {
940 continue;
941 }
942
943 if (inputVarying.name == "gl_PointCoord")
944 {
945 usesPointCoord = true;
946 break;
947 }
948
949 if (inputVarying.name == "gl_FragCoord")
950 {
951 usesFragCoord = true;
952 break;
953 }
954 }
955
956 if (compileOptions & SH_ADD_BRESENHAM_LINE_RASTER_EMULATION)
957 {
958 if (!AddBresenhamEmulationFS(this, compileOptions, sink, root, &getSymbolTable(),
959 driverUniforms, usesFragCoord))
960 {
961 return false;
962 }
963 }
964
965 bool hasGLFragColor = false;
966 bool hasGLFragData = false;
967 bool usePreRotation = compileOptions & SH_ADD_PRE_ROTATION;
968
969 for (const ShaderVariable &outputVar : mOutputVariables)
970 {
971 if (outputVar.name == "gl_FragColor")
972 {
973 ASSERT(!hasGLFragColor);
974 hasGLFragColor = true;
975 continue;
976 }
977 else if (outputVar.name == "gl_FragData")
978 {
979 ASSERT(!hasGLFragData);
980 hasGLFragData = true;
981 continue;
982 }
983 }
984 ASSERT(!(hasGLFragColor && hasGLFragData));
985 if (hasGLFragColor)
986 {
987 sink << "layout(location = 0) out vec4 webgl_FragColor;\n";
988 }
989 if (hasGLFragData)
990 {
991 sink << "layout(location = 0) out vec4 webgl_FragData[gl_MaxDrawBuffers];\n";
992 }
993
994 if (usesPointCoord)
995 {
996 TIntermBinary *flipXY = CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kNegFlipXY);
997 TIntermConstantUnion *pivot = CreateFloatNode(0.5f);
998 TIntermBinary *fragRotation =
999 usePreRotation ? CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kFragRotation) : nullptr;
1000 if (!RotateAndFlipBuiltinVariable(this, root, GetMainSequence(root), flipXY,
1001 &getSymbolTable(), BuiltInVariable::gl_PointCoord(),
1002 kFlippedPointCoordName, pivot, fragRotation))
1003 {
1004 return false;
1005 }
1006 }
1007
1008 if (usesFragCoord)
1009 {
1010 if (!InsertFragCoordCorrection(this, compileOptions, root, GetMainSequence(root),
1011 &getSymbolTable(), driverUniforms))
1012 {
1013 return false;
1014 }
1015 }
1016
1017 {
1018 TIntermBinary *flipXY = CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kFlipXY);
1019 TIntermBinary *fragRotation =
1020 usePreRotation ? CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kFragRotation) : nullptr;
1021 if (!RewriteDfdy(this, root, getSymbolTable(), getShaderVersion(), flipXY,
1022 fragRotation))
1023 {
1024 return false;
1025 }
1026 }
1027
1028 {
1029 TIntermBinary *flipXY = CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kFlipXY);
1030 TIntermBinary *fragRotation =
1031 usePreRotation ? CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kFragRotation) : nullptr;
1032 if (!RewriteInterpolateAtOffset(this, root, getSymbolTable(), getShaderVersion(),
1033 flipXY, fragRotation))
1034 {
1035 return false;
1036 }
1037 }
1038
1039 EmitEarlyFragmentTestsGLSL(*this, sink);
1040 }
1041 else if (getShaderType() == GL_VERTEX_SHADER)
1042 {
1043 if (compileOptions & SH_ADD_BRESENHAM_LINE_RASTER_EMULATION)
1044 {
1045 if (!AddBresenhamEmulationVS(this, root, &getSymbolTable(), driverUniforms))
1046 {
1047 return false;
1048 }
1049 }
1050
1051 // Add a macro to declare transform feedback buffers.
1052 sink << "@@ XFB-DECL @@\n\n";
1053
1054 // Append a macro for transform feedback substitution prior to modifying depth.
1055 if (!AppendVertexShaderTransformFeedbackOutputToMain(this, root, &getSymbolTable()))
1056 {
1057 return false;
1058 }
1059
1060 // Search for the gl_ClipDistance usage, if its used, we need to do some replacements.
1061 bool useClipDistance = false;
1062 for (const ShaderVariable &outputVarying : mOutputVaryings)
1063 {
1064 if (outputVarying.name == "gl_ClipDistance")
1065 {
1066 useClipDistance = true;
1067 break;
1068 }
1069 }
1070 if (useClipDistance && !ReplaceClipDistanceAssignments(
1071 this, root, &getSymbolTable(),
1072 CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kClipDistancesEnabled)))
1073 {
1074 return false;
1075 }
1076
1077 // Append depth range translation to main.
1078 if (!transformDepthBeforeCorrection(root, driverUniforms))
1079 {
1080 return false;
1081 }
1082 if (!AppendVertexShaderDepthCorrectionToMain(this, root, &getSymbolTable()))
1083 {
1084 return false;
1085 }
1086 if ((compileOptions & SH_ADD_PRE_ROTATION) != 0 &&
1087 !AppendPreRotation(this, root, &getSymbolTable(), driverUniforms))
1088 {
1089 return false;
1090 }
1091 }
1092 else if (getShaderType() == GL_GEOMETRY_SHADER)
1093 {
1094 WriteGeometryShaderLayoutQualifiers(
1095 sink, getGeometryShaderInputPrimitiveType(), getGeometryShaderInvocations(),
1096 getGeometryShaderOutputPrimitiveType(), getGeometryShaderMaxVertices());
1097 }
1098 else
1099 {
1100 ASSERT(getShaderType() == GL_COMPUTE_SHADER);
1101 EmitWorkGroupSizeGLSL(*this, sink);
1102 }
1103
1104 if (!validateAST(root))
1105 {
1106 return false;
1107 }
1108
1109 if (driverUniformsOut)
1110 {
1111 *driverUniformsOut = driverUniforms;
1112 }
1113
1114 return true;
1115}
1116
1117bool TranslatorVulkan::translate(TIntermBlock *root,
1118 ShCompileOptions compileOptions,
1119 PerformanceDiagnostics *perfDiagnostics)
1120{
1121
1122 TInfoSinkBase &sink = getInfoSink().obj;
1123
1124 bool precisionEmulation = false;
1125 if (!emulatePrecisionIfNeeded(root, sink, &precisionEmulation, SH_GLSL_VULKAN_OUTPUT))
1126 return false;
1127
1128 bool enablePrecision = ((compileOptions & SH_IGNORE_PRECISION_QUALIFIERS) == 0);
1129
1130 TOutputVulkanGLSL outputGLSL(sink, getArrayIndexClampingStrategy(), getHashFunction(),
1131 getNameMap(), &getSymbolTable(), getShaderType(),
1132 getShaderVersion(), getOutputType(), precisionEmulation,
1133 enablePrecision, compileOptions);
1134
1135 if (!translateImpl(root, compileOptions, perfDiagnostics, nullptr, &outputGLSL))
1136 {
1137 return false;
1138 }
1139
1140 // Write translated shader.
1141 root->traverse(&outputGLSL);
1142
1143 return true;
1144}
1145
1146bool TranslatorVulkan::shouldFlattenPragmaStdglInvariantAll()
1147{
1148 // Not necessary.
1149 return false;
1150}
1151
1152TIntermSwizzle *TranslatorVulkan::getDriverUniformNegFlipYRef(const TVariable *driverUniforms) const
1153{
1154 // Create a swizzle to "negFlipXY.y"
1155 TIntermBinary *negFlipXY = CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kNegFlipXY);
1156 TVector<int> swizzleOffsetY = {1};
1157 TIntermSwizzle *negFlipY = new TIntermSwizzle(negFlipXY, swizzleOffsetY);
1158 return negFlipY;
1159}
1160
1161TIntermBinary *TranslatorVulkan::getDriverUniformDepthRangeReservedFieldRef(
1162 const TVariable *driverUniforms) const
1163{
1164 TIntermBinary *depthRange = CreateDriverUniformRef(driverUniforms, kDepthRange);
1165
1166 return new TIntermBinary(EOpIndexDirectStruct, depthRange, CreateIndexNode(3));
1167}
1168
1169} // namespace sh
